coverAlt: Apparently the 48th A Book Apart Book with forward by Cassidy Williams
title: Surviving Change at Work
subTitle: Find clarity as you drive toward the next step in your tech career.
author: Vanessa Gennarelli
description: Great because it also has some practical exercises to complete. I frequently recommmend this title.

coverAlt: A medal with ribbon that also looks like a speach bubble
title: The Storytelling Hero
subTitle: Speaking for Powerful Communication
author: Steward Bewley
description: Another title with practical exercises. Its also a very quick and quality read.

coverAlt: An illustrated word Breath that makes it look like the letters are evaporating
title: Breath
subTitle: The New Science of a Lost Art
author: James Nestor
description: One of those Malcom Gladwell style books. Probably the best parts is how the reader can't help but practice breathing exercises while reading. It's like it has its own built-in

coverAlt: Illustration of a nose
title: Science of Breath
subTitle: A Practical Guide
author: Swami Rama

coverAlt: Simple cover graphic with 2 circles
title: The Creative Act
subTitle: A Way of Being
author: Rick Rubin

coverAlt: A bridge and a glowing light
title: Annabel Scheme
subTitle: And the Adventure of the New Golden Gate
author: Robin Sloan

coverAlt: Apparently the 33rd title from A Book Apart with a forward by Yasmine Mustafa
title: Design for Cognitive Bias
subTitle: Understand the logic powering human bias and learn to start designing more consciously
author: David Dylan Thomas
description: I highlighted this one so much. Will be worthy of it’s own culture moment or blog post.

coverAlt: Apparently the 47th title from A Book Apart with a forward by Clarissa Redwine
title: You Deserve a Tech Union
subTitle: By standing together, we can build a better version of the tech industry
author: Ethan Marcotte
description: I enjoy this title because it really reinforces the themes of ethics and fairness that needs to be a part of all our work.

coverAlt: A woman riding a bike while holding onto a van
title: Other Means
author: Various

coverAlt: A simple cover with some quotes in some colorful circles, one has the sub title and the other has the phrase the co-creators of Axios and Politico
title: Smart Brevity
subTitle: The Power of Saying More with Less
author: Jim VandeHei, Mike Allen, Roy Schwartz
description: I have mixed feelings. It’s important to communicate this way, but I very much miss good prose. So I plan to take what I need and leave the rest

coverAlt: Some very distressed looking text that looks overlayed on some documentation about websites
title: Multipage Version
subTitle: Issue #1: We Fucked Up Headings
author: Various

coverAlt: A scene of earth and sky with a gigantic rip in the clouds that exposes a moon. The letters on the book also glow in the dark!
title: Moonbound
subTitle: A Novel
author: Robin Sloan
description: The best part of Sloan’s books is all the extras you get with them. A pre-order means you get printed matter and the author website contains all kinds of hidden gems. All of the deep story makes you want to be part of the world.

coverAlt: Just some very brutalist looking text witht he tile of the magazine repeated several times
title: The Prompt Issue 2
subTitle: A Magazine by Figma
author: Multiple
description: The physical copy is very difficult to read because of very small text and transparent pages. Totally read the online version of these articles.

coverAlt: A simple design that also indicates the second edition
title: San Francisco
subTitle: Wildsam Field Guides
author: Multiple
description: This series is better than other guides. There are particular histories like cultural movements, timelines, and illustrated maps. Also fun, the cover is in International Orange, the same as the Golden Gate Bridge.

coverAlt: A book cover with a boy with a big smile and a girl with a crown
title: The Brief Wondrous Life of Oscar Wao
author: Junot Díaz
description: This was the ultimate beach read when visiting the main protagonist of this novel, the Dominican Republic. I could have sworn that I had read this before, and I can't remember what book it reminded me so much of. Perhaps that is why I liked it so much.

coverAlt: A beat up looking business manual
title: Severance
subTitle: The Lexington Letter
author: Anonymous
description: Like reading a mini episode of the popular show. Toteally excited for the second season because sometimes I feel like I need to be severed from my corporate job.

coverAlt: A iconic cover with a young Harry Potter riding a broom and flying into Hogwarts
title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling

coverAlt: An illustrated scene of an open book with dark figures walking through city strets
title: Shadow of the Wind
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón

coverAlt: An image of a cookie cutter in the shape of a person over a background of flat color
title: Filterworld
subTitle: How Algorithms Flattened Culture
author: Kyle Chayka
description: I skipped the middle part of this book. I think the best take-aways were found in the conclusion which covered the importance of curation and taste.

coverAlt: A graphic cover with a crow perched on top of a city
title: Hollow Kingdom
subTitle: A Novel
author: Kira Jane Buxton

coverAlt: the supercommunicators title of the book repeated over and over like the title is building
title: Supercommunicators
subTitle: How to Unlock the Secret Language of Connection
author: Charles Duhigg
description: A selection from bookclub and the summer reading list. This title gives advice on how to have better conversations and be that person that others want to connect with.
